page.title: 11BASSALEG FARMS-2
page.content: Neuadda farm is pre 17th century.The farm is mainly stock rearing.There are 86 Friesian-cross Hereford calves from 6-12 months old.It has 160 ewes which are mainly Welsh half breeds with some Cluns;Welsh mountain and the Isle of France,plus their lambs.The farm also has 30 laying hens and 200 turkeys for Christmas.The soil is mainly clay and 3000 bales of hay are made which they use for winter feed. All of the farms are well equipped with tractors;cultivators; drills for sowing and planting; machinery for hay and silage making; fertiliser spreaders and machinery for harvesting root crops.
